DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to perform brain scans using magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) instrument on children aged 6 months, 1 year, and 2 years. This procedure is usually done with sedation but the study will see if it can be done without sedation.
DOC.brief_title: Feasibility Study: MRI on 6 Months, 1 Year, and 2 Years Old Children Without Sedation
DOC.detailed_description: MRI examination of term infants without sedation at a later age (than newborn) can be feasible.
DOC.criteria: Term born Mother is 18 years or older Any previous or current neurological illness or other serious medical conditions Any conditions deemed by the investigators that are not suited for a MRI scan.
